com.gdxgame.core

Class GameInputAdapter

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.badlogic.gdx.InputAdapter
      • com.gdxgame.core.GameInputAdapter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.badlogic.gdx.controllers.ControllerListener, InputProcessor
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    GameStateLogic

    public abstract class GameInputAdapter
extends InputAdapter
implements com.badlogic.gdx.controllers.ControllerListener
    GameInputAdapter is the core class for input handling. It extends the libgdx InputAdapter to be able to listen to keyboard, mouse and touch events. It also implements the ControllerListener interface to be able to listen to Controller events.

    Use the libgdx Input.Keys class to compare they keycode parameter of the InputAdapter with the actual keys on the keyboard.

    Use the libgdx Input.Buttons class to compare the button parameter of the InputAdapter with the actual mouse buttons.

    For controllers you need to specifiy your own buttonCode matching since every controller will send different values for the buttonCode parameter.
